_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha
Supreme guide for those who wish to train
The Buddha's preferences for where mendi: A mendicant living within a village who is not immersed in samādhi
A mendicant in the wilderness who is sitting nodding in meditation
A mendicant in the wilderness who is sitting without being immersed in samādhi
A mendicant in the wilderness who is sitting immersed in samādhi
A mendicant who is living within a village receiving robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
A mendicant who is in the wilderness receiving robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
The Buddha's preferences for solitude [a: When the Buddha is walking along a road and doesn't see anyone ahead or behind, he feels relaxed, even if he needs to urinate or defecate.
